111.content:
The forest that Adrian was in now was said to be home to a bunch of Naga; half-snake/half-human creatures that were elusive. Local people from the little city that was at the edge of the forest told him all about the naga in the forest. In fact, the people consider the forest as the naga's forest as if the naga really owned it. One kid about seven named Danny told Adrian about how he got lost in the forest one time and ran into a nice naga named Carmen. According to Danny, Carmen was about 100 feet long and beautiful...for a naga. After hearing the tall-tales of the naga in the forest, he bought some camping gear and entered the dense forest.
Throughout the long day, Adrian saw no evidence of any naga; just the usual wildlife you'd find in any other forest. At one point, Adrian saw a bear off in the distance along with three or four little cubs. As the day wore on, Adrian doubted he would run into a naga...but it was a good hike. The forest had no paths to speak of. He kept following the stream deep into the forest. By early evening, Adrian had reached a high ridge that overlooked the small city of Oakdale. He took a moment to take in the sights, not noticing that he was being watched. By late evening, Adrian found a good place to set up a camp; a sizable clearing about 40 feet square. There, he found the remains of an ancient campfire. The old campsite looked to be about two years old. Adrian set up a medium-sized tent and built a large campfire and settled in for the night.
If the forest was noisy in daylight, it was nothing compared to the forest at night; there were animal noises everywhere and once or twice the long howl of a wolf. For dinner, Adrian had some hot dogs. He bought along a small battery-powered radio which he listened to the local rock station. At around midnight, Adrian had whipped out a camera that could see in the dark and decided to take a little stroll before settling in for bed. Adrian saw some squirrels with the camera and what looked to be a wolf in the distance. Then he spotted something on the ground; a sight heat signature on the ground. By the looks of it, the heat signature seemed to be some kind of track; a track that a snake would leave behind. Adrian carefully measured the track and found it was about 40 feet thick and 20 feet long. "That's one hell of a snake" said Adrian softly. Maybe the stories about the naga were real after all. Adrian returned to his campsite and crawled into his tent and sleeping bag and quickly fell asleep. The only sound at the campsite was the soft music from the radio.
Some time later, Adrian woke with a start. For a moment, Adrian looked around wildly to find what sound had woken him so suddenly. He clicked off the radio and listened. A faint dragging sound was coming from outside. It was steadily getting nearer. Adrian's first thought that it was a bear. Then he heard someone giggling softly.
"The radio hasssss gone sssssilent" said a soft voice that had a hissing quality.
"The batteriessss must've gone out" said another voice, a female one.
"Could it be naga....?" thought Adrian to himself. 'What should I do?'

“Don’t be afraid. I’m not like my mom.” Kiki said gently stroking Ellana’s back with her finger. Ellana eventually relaxed, but she was still wary. “My mom can get a little, overzealous, when it comes to humans. Ever since a bang of them tried to capture me years ago when I was a baby, she’s taken every opportunity to ‘prove our superiority’.”

“Can you help me escape?” Ellana blurted out. She covered her mouth as though she uttered some terrible swear, fearing what the young naga might do to her.

“I’m sorry, but I can’t.” Kiki said carefully scooping Ellana into her hand and bring the human to her face, “If you did escape, with or without my help, Mom would hunt you down. And this time she wouldn’t be so merciful, you’d be lucky if she ate you.”

“So, I’m stuck here?” Ellana asked forlornly.

“I’m afraid so. But at least you’ll have me around.” Kiki replied before her tongue darted out and wrapped around Ellana. “Sorry,” Kiki apologized as her tongue unraveled and returned to her mouth, “I just had to get a taste. Humans taste so good.”
1242111.title: Nice Kiki

124212.content:
No matter how much Ellana begged, her pleas fell on deaf ears. The naga giggled at Ellana’s desperate plea before tilting her head back.

Ellana felt the sudden incline to her surroundings. She tired to grab something but failed as she slid down the naga’s saliva coated tongue.

The naga traced her prey’s path with her hand, down her neck before the small lump passed beneath her collarbone. “Have a pleasant stay little one.” She said before slithering away from the scene.

Ellana landed with a small splash in the naga’s stomach. She tried to stand but the mucus lined walls and floor was too slippery. All she could do was sit and cry as the acids rose to digest her.

I’m going to take you home with me before I decide what I’ll do with you, this will merely render you unconscious for the trip. I’ve learned from the past how resourceful you humans are, I’m not going to risk you knowing how to get to my home, no matter how lost you were.” The naga replied, watching Ellana with amusement. Soon enough, as promised, Ellana blacked out.

12422121.content:
Ellana didn’t realize it, but she was in the giant naga’s womb. The naga, named Vylite, thought Ellana was a perfect candidate for her desire. While Ellana was out cold, Vylite pushed her through the lips of her vagina and up into her uterus. Ellana didn’t know that an umbilical chord now connected her to Vylite and her legs had transformed into a long snake-like tail. A wave of comfort suddenly swept over Ellana, washing away her fear before she fell asleep.

Vylite gently massaged her belly whispering, “It’s alright little one, everything’s okay.”
12422121.title: In the womb

124221211.content:
Ellana lost all track of time as she slept; her new body was growing, preparing for the day it would leave the womb.

One day Ellana woke and finally opened her eyes. It was midday, and she was gazing up at Vylite’s bright face. Ellana was cradled in Vylite’s arms close to her chest, close to the warmth from her breasts. Vylite was still big to her, but not as big as she was when Ellana went unconscious. “M… mommy…” Ellana squeaked. “That’s right little one, I’m your mommy.” Vylite said softly with a bright smile. In a far flung corner of Ellana’s mind her old self was in hysterics, NO! She’s not my mother! This can’t be! but the rest of Ellana’s mind rejoiced at seeing her new mother.

A tiny gurgle escaped Ellana’s stomach. “Oh, it seems you’re hungry. I guess it’s time to feed you.” Vylite cooed before gently bringing Ellana to one of her nipples. Ellana suckled from Vylite’s breast and both felt the bond of family growing stronger between them. When she finished, a small burp escaped Ellana’s mouth. “Aw, that’s my good little girl.” Vylite cooed as she rubbed Ellana’s back, “I love you sweety.”
124221211.title: Reborn

1242212111.content:
Five years had past since Ellana was reborn as Vylite’s daughter, now she was almost half as tall as her mother and her tail was about half the length of Vylite’s. One day, Ellana’s fifth birthday to be exact, Vylite told her, “Now you stay here sweetie, Mommy will be back shortly.” before slithering away. It was around the time that Vylite went out to hunt for their evening meals, so Ellana wasn’t upset by her mother’s departure. Ellana curled up in a corner of the nest, thinking about her life. Vylite was a very caring mother; she was always there for Ellana. For the first year or so Vylite breast-fed Ellana, then started feeing her small animals like squirrels, raccoons and, rabbits.

Ellana was napping when Vylite returned; her stomach was filled with three humans all vainly struggling against her stomach walls to escape. “Ellana, wake up sweetie. Mommy’s got a surprise for you.” Vylite whispered into Ellana’s ear. Ellana yawned and stretched both her arms and tail as she woke up, “A surprise?” She asked as she sat up and gazed up at her mother. Vylite smiled and nodded before gently taking Ellana’s hands and putting them in a cupped position next to each other. She then brought the end of her tail forward, revealing a wriggling male human wrapped in her coils. Vylite released her tail’s hold on the man who fell into Ellana’s waiting hands. “It this for me?” Ellana asked excitedly as she gripped the man so he couldn’t escape. “Yes it is Ellana. My mother started feeding me humans when I turned five, now it’s time for you to start.” Vylite said. Ellana looked at the frightened man in her hands and the part of her mind that was the old human Ellana burst into hysterics again, Oh No! I can’t eat another person! It’s not right, I don’t care if I am a naga now, I won’t eat another human! But the instincts of Ellana’s naga body and mind were too strong. She put the human in her mouth as Vylite watched, pride for her daughter radiating from her. After a moment of savoring the human’s extraordinary taste, Ellana swallowed. She felt the human sliding down her throat and landing in her stomach. “Oh, I’m so proud of you Ellana.” Vylite exclaimed as she hugged Ellana. “Thank you Mommy, that was wonderful.” Ellana said as she hugged her mother back.

“It’s time to go to sleep now Ellana.” Vylite said as she curled around her daughter for the night. Ellana settled in by her mother’s chest and said, “Good night Mommy.” before going to sleep. Vylite smiled as she pushed some of Ellana’s hair from her face. “I’m truly blessed to have such a beautiful daughter.” She whispered to herself before she too settled down for the night.
1242212111.title: Ellana the naga

choices: Some humans come looking for Ellana
12422121111.content:
The next day was not too different from the previous one. The only real noticeable difference was now Vylite would return from her hunts with a tasty human for Ellana. Ellana was always excited to get her human from her mother, they tasted so good and their struggles made her giggle.


It was the night that was different.

Vylite put Ellana to bed like every night before that, then eventually went to sleep herself. But tonight things went wrong. Vylite had been asleep for a few hours when her senses picked up something. She rose from the nest, taking care not to disturb her daughter to look around. A faint glow in the distance was all she could see, but the noises carried by the gentle breeze filled her with fear for her daughter’s safety. “Ellana. Ellana sweetie, wake up.” She said urgently shaking her daughter’s shoulder.

“What is it Mommy, breakfast?” Ellana asked sleepily.

“No dear, it’s too early. Now listen closely, you need to leave. Now. Go to the place we talked about. And do not leave until I come get you. Go!” Vylite said hurriedly. She watched as Ellana slithered away before turning back to the glow. The oncoming army of humans would not harm so much as a hair on Ellana if she could do anything about.


The place Ellana went was a tall, ancient tree. As her mother told her, Ellana climbed up the trunk of the tree and hid among the leaves to wait. She didn’t know why her mother told her to leave, but she was certain her mother would come soon.

Aurora was a bit surprised by Ellana’s acceptance. “Well, you’re welcome, but why? Nothing personal but I expected you to want out, to want to avoid becoming a naga.”

I never told anyone before about it because they’d think I was mad, insane, and probably would have burned me at the stake.” Ellana replied.

Aurora smiled as she heard Ellana’s story, and she could relate to dreaming of being one of the giant sized nagas. But as far as she and the rest of the naga race knew, the only way to become a giant naga was to be born one. “Well then, I guess this’ll make at least some of your dreams come true. Her mother's nervousness eases at her Daughter's calmer, yet shaky tone, and tilts her head, smiling. "Yeah. But I guess that's only natural for you to be so excited. Your finally what you've dreamed of becoming, and better yet, your getting to test out your new form."

The larger naga is calmed by her mother's understanding. She smiles at Aurora with warmth and love in her gaze. She speaks in a quiet and calm tone. " About that. Aurora?"

Aurora is a bit confused when her daughter uses her name instead of calling her mom. "Yes, Ellana?"

The giant naga takes a moment to lean in, down to the now much smaller naga woman, using her arms for support. Aurora is caught off guard and mistakes this for an eating crouch and puts her arms up in defense, closing her eyes tight.

Ellena sees that and stops, her face a very small space away from her mother's. She waits, patiently for her mother to calm herself and as Aurora realizes she is not being sucked down her daughter's lips, she peeks an eye open to see Ellana's unchanged, warm and loving expression. She lets her guard down, seeing that her daughter truly meant no true harm and stared at her a bit confused.

The larger naga leans in, eyes closed and plants a long, soft and warm kiss on her mother's cheek. Aurora froze up, but not in fear, just in surprise. Her cheeks turned red in a hot blush. As Ellana pulls away, ending the kiss and reopening her eyes, looking at Aurora with a humble expression. Her answer finally comes. "Thank you, Aurora... All this happened, because of you..."

Aurora blinks once, pausing for a moment. Then a small smile appears on her blushing face. "Your welcome... Ellana."


30 minutes later, the two have made their ways into the Forest of Whispers. This place was a good start for a first hunt to try out Ellana's new potential.

Ellana looked over the area around her, but her vision was horribly limited by the treetops blocking her view. She was just too tall to see anything. She then turns her attention to her mother. She leans down and whispers into her ear, aware that her voice would be loud enough to scare off all the prey in the area as full volume. "Mom?"

Aurora hears her as she is holding a kowo cat in her hand, but cat turn to her to see her face, or she might lose her prey. "Yes, my dear?"

"How am I supposed to catch prey when my head literally towers above the tree? I can't see a thing!"

As Aurora swallows the kowo cat down into her belly, she looks at her daughter and smiles. "Easy. You see what your doing to speak down to me, right now?"

Ellana looks at herself, seeing her point. Because of Ellana's naga half, superb back and stomach muscles, she was able to lean low to the ground without tiring and falling over. This was what Aurora was referring to. This simple solution made Ellana feel silly and embarrassed for asking. She looked at her mother, her embarrassment showing through in a nervous grin and light blush. "Ehehehe.. right! S-silly me~!"

Aurora smiles, looking playful. She teased her. "You might be big, but bigger doesn't mean more experienced~!" She then giggles and turns away, continuing on to find more prey.

As Ellan goes to follow, she feels a movement not too far behind her. Ellana freezes, then turns to see a "large", feathered body who's long beak picked at the ground. It was a Glouteux fowl bird! The perfect sized first meal! But the the question was, would this dodo bird really be stupid enough to stay in that one spot? (Glouteux' are EXTREME dense and severely lack intelligence.)


Does she catch her prey or is it lucky enough to see her coming and run away?
12521222221122212.title: A Hungry, Giant Naga!

choices: (Real question) "Has a naga ever eaten another naga, Giant or not?"
(Delaying question) "Can we please call it a day on the hunting?"
125212222211222121.content:
Ellana carefully Creeps toward the fowl. Even though Ellana's tail which lay right in side of it, the fowl doesn't suspect a thing. This creature really WAS as intellectual challenged as she had been told by her mother.

Aurora saw what her daughter was doing and watched her creep up upon her prey, eager to see her catch her first prey as a giant naga.

Ellana got close enough to this creature that she could literally stick out her tongue and lick it. Instead, she grabs it in both hands and prepares for a struggle... but it doesn't react! She stared at the thing, but it only looks around in confusion, still not completely sure of what's going on. She was dumbfounded at how utterly idiotic this bird was. She thought to herself. {What the... I just grabbed the thing and all it does is look around? Exactly how stupid IS this bird?} She waits a moment, then just shrugs it off. {Oh well. Prey is prey~. Even if it's dumb prey.}

She lifts the bird up to her mouth and starts stuffing it in, head first. She has to dislodge her jaw a little because even though she was a giant naga now, it was still as big as a small chicken to her. She takes a gulp, sucking the head and upper body into her esophagus as it begins to make a bulge, both in her mouth and her throat.

At this point, the idiot bird finally realizes what's occurring, but it is now completely helpless to move much more than a slight wiggle, due to it's tight surroundings. It can only lay in wait for what will happen next.

Aurora is just giddy at the sight of Ellana's throat bulge and with an excited agape smile and equally excited, sparkling eyes, she watches as he daughter takes another swallow, sending the fowl deeper inside, it's body now in her mouth completely, allowing her to relocate and attach her jaw, making a larger bulge apparent half in her throat and half out. That is quickly remedied with another gulp and now it is traveling down her esophagus toward it's final destination. Her stomach.

The motherly naga couldn't be more awestruck if she tried at this point. She could literally feel her heart start to race intensely in her excitement. It felt it would pop right out of her chest if it beat any harder or any faster.

Ellana feels the fowl bird slip down her esophagus in a wide bulge and as it reaches the end, she gives it one last swallow as it slips through quickly and *PLOP*! It lands in the digestive juices of her stomach.

Now allowed more room, the bird starts to flop around, looking for ways to get out, but it quickly realizes that it's hopeless.

Ellana, straightens her human half back up and looks at her just slightly bulging belly. She gives it a few pats, smiling playfully. "Sorry, little guy, but you weren't nearly fast enough~!"

Aurora quickly slithers over to Ellana and gives her a congratulatory hug on the side of her waist. "That was incredible, Ellana! I've never seen a naga eat a glouteux WHOLE, so easily~! That was just amazing!"

The young, giant naga smiled down at her and was about to thank her, but then she realized that what Aurora said was odd somehow, looking puzzled as her smile quickly disappeared. "Whadiya mean?"

Aurora then jumps as she hears her and looks up, noticeably nervous. She stops her hug, separating from the much larger naga and backing up so that she isn't hurting her neck as much to look up. "O-oh! Umm... Well.. You see, your the first naga that I've ever truly seen reach this size, truth be told. I didn't really expect for you to get this big, much less in such a short time." Sweat forms on her brow as she rubs the back of her head with growing nervousness as she goes on. "You may just be the biggest naga in all the lands! Ehhehehe..he.."

Ellana was quite surprised by this, if not even a little shocked. She was finding it truly hard to believe that she was the biggest naga in existence. She thought there were surely more like her. Maybe even more bigger than her, but to learn that she was the biggest... She looked at Aurora. "Is that true?"

Aurora nods. "Yes. Not even Malika is as big as you..."

Ellana looks away from her mother and up at the daytime sky, thinking of it. She was truly a giant among giants... She looks down at her mother, feeling like she has butterflies in her stomach, even though the only thing in there was a giant fowl, soon to be digested. She easily Dwarfs her in size, but she can't decide if this was good or bad to her.

On one hand, she was happy to be the biggest naga, one with many more choices in prey than all the others, but on the other hand, at this size, she could easily get other ideas in time, especially now that she knew she was one of the highest on the food chain. But was that really a good thing?

She spoke in a hesitant tone to her mother. "Mom?"

Aurora looks confused and nervous. "Y-yes, dear?"

Ellana had only one question she wanted to ask, but something was holding her back. The words were being choked back by uncertainty.


What would she do? Would she ask the real question that had her confused, or would she ask a delaying question to put it off until later on. Either way, now was the time to pipe up or she may worry her mother more that intended. The question on her mind was already worry enough for her...

142.content:
Rin knew it was likely the human would run away from her, since she was a naga, before she got the chance to talk to him; so she decided to ask for help from the sorceress.

Czarina, the naga sorceress, lived deep in the heart of the forest away from the other nagas who lived closer to the edges. The dark stories about her kept popping into Rin’s mind, pleading for her to go back, but she pressed ahead. If anyone could help her it would be Czarina.


“Hello. Anyone here?” Rin called out when she reached the ancient and abandoned human castle where Czarina lived.

“Welcome child, to what do I owe this pleasure?” Czarina replied as she slithered from the forest behind Rin. Czarina was incredibly old, but the only sign of her age was her long silver hair, otherwise she appeared no older than 25. Like many nagas she didn’t wear clothes, but she wore a gold necklace studded with gems, most were oddly dull and colorless, but there were a few that were vibrant and stunning.

“I- I came to ask for your help.” Rin stuttered nervously.

There’s no need to be afraid child. Now tell me: what is your problem?” Czarina said comfortingly, slithering around Rin and beckoning her to follow.

“Well, I’m supposed to select my mate, but the only one I’m interested in is a human.” Rin said as she slithered after Czarina into the castle.

“Ah, I see.” Czarina said as she lay on a couch in the entry room, “So you wish to be human, of for him to be a naga.”

“Yes, preferably… preferably turn me into a human.’ Rin said, almost chocking on the words.

“Intriguing, most nagas would abhor the idea of becoming human.” Czarina said.

“Can you do it? Or rather, will you do it?” Rin pleaded.

“Very well, but my services don’t come freely.” Czarina answered.

“Of course, what is your fee?” Rin asked hopefully.

Czarina smiled, “My fee is…”

144.content:
“You will come back to me…won’t you?”
“Of course, I’ll come back for you. We promised to always love each other, didn’t we?” The red haired child said. Despite the brave words, deep blue eyes were welling with tears.
“But…you’re leaving for 5 years! At least! How can you be so sure that you’ll still love me? You’re going to be meeting people from your own race, could you still love a…a…”
“A naga?” asked the human. Her green eyes looked back up at her fiery haired lover. The human placed a hand on her brown mop of hair. After a few moments it lowered to her chin, forcing the girl to look back up.
“Then let this be proof that you are the only person in this world for me” the human said before their lips met. They stayed like that, joined together for at least a few minutes. When their lips parted, the tears had stopped but the naga held an uncertain look in her eyes.
“I have to go now Lily. The caravan should have already arrived and they’ll come looking for me.” The human pulled the naga into a warm embrace while speaking. “I only have to live with them until I’m considered an adult. When that happens, I’ll come back to you. Wait for me by the oak tree in the summers. When we meet again…I’ll make you my bride…”
The human pulled back and looked at Lily one last time. Her messy brown hair, her emerald eyes, and her long brown tail. Lily couldn’t stop her sobbing to respond. With a final kiss on her forehead, the human turned and began to walk back towards the far off cabin. After a few steps, Lily gathered her voice, closed her eyes, and yelled “I’ll be there Nat! I’ll wait for you as long as it takes! Even if we change, I’ll be there for when we’re adults! And then…then…THEN I’LL MATE WITH YOU!” A deep flush came over her face before she fled into the woods. Nat smiled and continued onward towards the cabin, where a small group of armed individuals were waiting.

“So, then what happened?”
“That’s the last time I saw him. This is the fifth year since he left, and I’ve been waiting for him every year since then. Once I see him again, I have to make it clear that…”
“That you turned out a lesbian after screaming you’d sleep with him?” asked her friend with a smirk. Lily shot a glare over to her friend Mana. She had befriended the blonde naga around a year ago, she had short hair, green eyes, and a golden tail with a yellow underbelly. They were on good terms despite one of them being human sized and the other giant. She had come over and wanted to know why Lily was hanging around the giant oak tree.
“Yes, there’s that. I also want to let him down subtly; I really did love him when we were young. Even now I can’t help but feel it for him. He was tall, cool, and was good looking…but there was no way for me to know that I’d end up liking girls!”
“How good looking are we talking? The handsome ones always taste better…” she teased. Lily just smirked.
“Very. He has this fiery red hair, deep blue eyes, and a feminine looking face. While he probably does taste good, there’s no point in eating him. I was so scared of him getting eaten when we were kids that I snuck into my aunt’s cave and stole one of her potions to make him indigestible. He’d just stay in your gut, and also I’d prefer if you don’t eat my friends!” She couldn’t help but cringe at the memory of her punishment by her Aunt. A week in her belly…all for a boy that ended up never needing the protection.
“Oh, maybe I should just scoop him for myself, tall, handsome, and won’t die in my belly…but there’s one more part I need to know about…”
“What?”
“You know…the “little Nat”…or if it’s a “big Nat”…” Lily’s face flooded with crimson as she snapped over to look Mana in the eyes.
“I-I-I never saw it! Geez, knock it off will ya?! I didn’t exactly follow him to the bathroom when we were kids!”
“Wait, so you never saw it?”
“NO!”
“So how do you know he’s a man?”
“…huh?”
“You said he had a feminine face and you never saw his junk. How do you know “he” wasn’t just a tomboy?” Lily was stumped. She had never considered this possibility before. They were 13 years old back then, so neither of them was maturing yet. The thought that her childhood love might actually work out for her made her heart flutter. By now, that would make Nat quite a beautiful woman. It was a possibility, except for…
“Mana, you know that humans can’t stand homosexuality. They have LAWS against it out there, so even if Nat was a girl he wouldn’t love me.”
“I suppose you’re right…well, I should probably head back before Nena gets hungry. Last time I was late she tried to eat ME…”
“Alright Mana, I’ll see you later” Lily said. With that, Mana slithered down from her high branch and took off into the forest. All of these memories were making her feel nostalgic. Lily slithered down herself and stood in front of the base, staring at an old carving. L + NW FOREVER. Lily sighed as she felt along the grooves…this was going to be hard. If Nat came back still in love with her she would have to turn him away. It made her a bit scared. A small part of her wished he would never show up…

The caravan driver was scared. He was just a town to town merchant trying to get by, so of course he was good smuggling. Food, weapons, even people. But this time was different. The pouch of gold weighed heavy in his pocket, and he was worried about seeing a stampede of knights coming after him. Even with a hood on, he noticed the long red hair. Only the Webber family possessed red hair. Those groups of nobles were dukes and duchesses…and he was now carrying their famous problem child. The child had been brought into the infamous naga woods as a child by the disgraced father. If they notice the child was gone, an entire battalion would butcher him. He nervously looked back at the hooded figure, who was simply staring at the sky.

Nat remembered all the time spent with Lily. Carving their initials in the oak tree, playing down in the river, her nasty attempt at making juice… She would be fully grown now. A deep fear that she wouldn’t remember or care about Nat surfaced. While Lily had promised to wait, nagas ate humans. Why keep a promise to food? Nat’s thoughts flooded back to the day the Webber family came to the cabin. A group of cousins, uncles and aunts were waiting in an impressive castle upon arrival. The most notable memory was Aunt Cassandra. She was incredibly beautiful, but would give the worst beatings. She would always justify herself by saying “I’ll make you a proper lady even if it breaks us both!”
The caravan hit a rock, shaking Natalie Webber out of her thoughts. Her hood had fallen off, exposing her long fiery hair. She hurriedly covered back up and looked towards the driver. He was facing forward. A sigh of relief escaped her rosy lips, if anyone knew she was a Webber they would likely bring her back in hopes of a reward. But there was no way she could allow that to happen. She had a bride to get to. Her family had tried to beet it out of her, but boys held no interest to her. Every arranged marriage had failed when she failed to appear at the altar. But that never stopped the next one. After all, she really had become a proper lady that every man wished to wed. It worried her that Lily might not like her new, gentler personality. She had fallen for the tomboy part of her after all…
Taking a peak out the door her heart began to race.
“This is where I get off. I thank you for your service, sir” she declared. Hopping off the carriage, the man turned and called out to her.
“Missy, this is the naga woods! You’ll die in there!”
“Maybe so, but I have some business to attend to inside.” With that, she took off her hood and ran into the tree line with only her knapsack of supplies and clothes. Her lovely Lily would be there for her, she had to believe in that. Going off her memory, she estimated it would take an hour to reach their tree. Only an hour left before their reunion.
144.title: Lily and Natalie

choices: Lily latched onto her head (She's human sized)
1441.content:
Lily let her arms hang from her favorite branch. From her perch she could see the clearing around the great tree. It stood taller than even the largest of nagas, easily 300 feet tall. She only really left her perch to hunt or switch branches. The thing about waiting for a childhood romance is that it can get incredibly BORING. Hours just droned on with nothing to do but reminisce. Today was especially bad. There haven’t been many humans around lately, so she’s had to hunt deer for the entire week. She could really go for some humans to play with. As much as it embarrassed her, she had a thing for human women. Most of them would just run away, and Lily would eat them. But those oddballs that stuck around…they all ended trying to run and digested. She really wanted to find a nice human girl that could move passed her species. One that’s thin, sexy, gentle…Someone that she could protect and tease. It’s thoughts like these that make it hard for her to wait for someone she has to break up with. She could really go for some fun… It was then that she heard some bushes rustling.

Natalie Webber had been exploring the forest that she used to call home. Her first stop was the cabin that her father had built when she was just a baby. The forest was bringing back memory of her childhood. Her father was a large man with enough combat prowess to take down ten men. His name of Armand Hexler, he had dark hair and eyes with a long beard. He knew that his area of the forest isn’t very crowded because of the berries that grew around it. The berries had poison in them, and the animals knew not to eat them. Without animals to hunt and poison fruit, humans and nagas alike stayed away. She never knew her mother as she had died giving birth. Her name was Camila Webber. Her father was a commoner at birth, but became a knight through radical service in the army. He was assigned to her mother as a bodyguard…so of course their love was forbidden. They had covered up her pregnancy as long as they could before fleeing to the woods. The Webber blood was strong, and Natalie grew looking like her mother.
Armand was truly a strange man compared to other humans. He seemed to love everything there was in life. Social statuses weren’t important to him, and he believed in true love. He had never taught her that homosexuality was evil like her Aunt did. When she told him about Lily, he just smiled and proclaimed “Love is Love!”
But he was a man in 50s. When he grew sick, he knew that there was no way he could afford a doctor. So he traveled to the road and sent a message to the Webbers. He said that Natalie was the bastard child between Camila and another noble that eh heard had passed. He proclaimed that he felt guilty for kidnapping Camila and her unborn child. He made sure to explain everything to Natalie very carefully. She was to be raised by her mother’s family, even if it resulted in his execution. She had refused at first, not wanting to leave Lily or lose her father.
“Natalie, listen to me and engrave these words into your heart. I’m just a sick old man that will be gone either way. You will move past me, and you don’t have to worry about Lily. True love transcends everything, you will find a way back to her.”
Her father was right, the proof being her presence back at her childhood home. She stood in front of her old home to find it destroyed. It appeared that a storm had caved in the roof.
“Ok…no place to live…I hope Lily is fine with me staying with her…” she muttered. Being here allowed her to get her bearings and set off for the tree. Every step made her feel a little more nervous. What if Lily HAD changed? What if she didn’t want her as a part of her life? What if she wasn’t into women anymore? What if…what if she had found someone else? The thought made her stop in her tracks. Natalie had held onto her love for the naga throughout the years…but what if Lily couldn’t? She was betting everything in her life for a predator that might not even love her anymore. At that thought, she slapped herself. She couldn’t afford to have thoughts like these. If love truly transcends everything, she didn’t need to worry. She kept moving onward. After a few more minutes she came upon a wide clearing with a large oak tree in the center. After pushing through some overgrown bushes she ended up falling onto the soft grass. Quickly scrambling up, dusting herself off, she then checked the surrounding area. Luckily she didn’t see Lily anywhere. It would have been embarrassing for her to see Natalie fall on her face. She walked up to the large base of the tree with a smile on her lips. The carving she had made years ago was there. However, underneath it was a new one. “YEARS APART” was carved with 5 lines near it. She was the one who taught Lily to write, so it made her proud to see that she was applying it. Reaching into her bag she pulled out a knife to write another message.
“Don’t you dare touch that, human” someone angrily said.

Lily watched as the human entered the clearing. She was easily the cutest thing she had ever seen. She was wearing a plain hooded cloak, but underneath was an elegant blue dress. She had a slim build, but some nice assets. Long, red hair draped down halfway to her back. Her blue eyes looked around the clearing, as if scared of something. Given her stature, they were likely around the same age. It had been so cute to see her fall over. This girl was definitely her type. At least she could have a bit of fun…she silently moved towards the lower branches while watching her approach the trunk. She was a little hungry at the moment, so she was debating eating her compared to flirting. She seemed like the timid type, so she would probably end up eating her either way. But the decision was clear when the girl pulled out a knife and put it up to her engraving.
“Don’t you dare touch that human” she hissed.

Natalie looked up at the voice, but the sun was shining in her eyes. She could only make out the outline to a busty naga, but she knew. The one above her was the love of her life. Her Lily had grown up, but had actually waited for her. But why was she angry? Perhaps she didn’t recognize her? That hurt a little, but it should have been expected. She had completely changed in her time away, but Lily should have at least pieced together the pieces. This called for some teasing.
“Oh, hello miss naga. Is this your carving? I say it and realized that this must be a very unique spot.”
“Put the knife away” she ordered. “That carving is between me and someone special. This entire area is special to us.”
“Is that so? Well this person must truly be important for you if you claim such a magnificent area for the both of you. Pray tell, where is this special person.”
“I…I don’t know. We were separated years ago, and I’m waiting for him to return…” Him? Did she just say HIM? Natalie may have been a tomboy but she couldn’t believe Lily actually made a mistake like that.
“Truly? How sad to hear, but at least you would NEVER forget that person right?” she asked, venom lining her words.

Lily actually recoiled a little. Why was this human getting angry at her? Then she did something that made her see red. The human drove the knife deep into the trunk and looked up at her with challenging eyes.
“Oh that is IT!”

Natalie hit the dagger right next to their initials. She had enough strength in the swing to keep it lodged in the bark. She was about to scold Lily for being so stupid when Lily made the first move. She saw the naga leap from her branch with her mouth wide open.
“Lily, NO!” she cried out before…
1441.title: Complications

choices: They head to their new home
14411.content:
Lily unhinged her jaws mid air as she plummeted towards the intruder. She coiled the tip of her tail around the branch to stop herself from hitting the ground.
"Lily, no!" she cried out. A second later her mouth hit the head of the terrified girl. Her lips stretched easily over her head. The momentum she carried from falling pushed Lily down all the way to the woman's knees. A muffled scream rang out from within her. Her head had shot straight through Lily's human stomach and had pushed into her snake stomach. The woman began struggling for her life, but it was far too late. Lily slowly released her tail from the high branch and placed herself on the ground. She straightened herself out to let gravity help her as she gave another swallow.


Inside, Nat was terrified. Lily had taken in the majority of her body in a single swallow, leaving only her calves outside. She tried to scream, tried to fight, but the stretchy flesh muffled her voice and pushed against her on all sides.
"Lily! Lily stop it! It's me, Natalie! Stop! Stop eating me!" she begged. Instead, she felt herself get turned upside down and another swallow dragged her down to her ankles. Two more swallows and Natalie found her entire world to be a hot, wet and shifting tunnel of flesh. Her entire body was completely inside of the naga, slowly sliding into her lower half.

She finally slowed down when her feet pushed into the snake stomach to join her. She felt a pressure from outside the soft walls squeeze around her, Lily was hugging her from the outside!


Lily was panting when she finally got the woman's boots down her throat. That was by far the tastiest human she had ever eaten. She had swallowed her down so fast that she was only left with the remnants of her flavor. She watched the human shaped bulge slowly work its way down into her snake half. Looking over to her carving, she checked the damage. But to her surprise, the knife was wedged far away from her own marks. Why did the woman do that?

She lowered herself to the ground and wrapped an arm around the woman trapped in her belly. "Hey there, why did you avoid the carving? Were you just trying to make me angry?" She placed a hand over the outline of her breast and gave it a squeeze. The woman squirmed heavily in response. "Or were you trying to make me eat you? Well, mission accomplished!"
"Damnit Lily, let me go!" she cried out.
"Wait...you know who I am?" she asked surprised. She let go of her breast and sat up straight. "How do you know me?"
"You idiot! It's me! Natalie Webber!" she yelled. That made Lily stop and think. Natalie? That name sounded familiar...But how? She looked over to her carving: L + NW. NW...Natalie Webber?!
"...Nat?"
"YES!" she screamed. Lily's blood turned cold at that. She turned over and immediately started to heave. Forcing her stomach muscles into reverse she began to bring her fiance out of her and into the open air. It was quite an unpleasant process, like throwing up without a break for about fifteen minutes.

When it was done, Nat was left soaked in saliva but untouched by acids. As soon as she was free, she had backed a few feet back and glared at the naga girl. Lily looked apologetically at her, but also with curiosity. Nat was supposed to be a man, yet before her was a lovely woman who claimed to be the same person. She was far more beautiful than when they were children. Her long red hair, her supple curves, yet the same burning blue eyes... Mana's words rang out in her head that she couldn't know Nat's gender as kids.
"Nat...is it really you?" she asked carefully, like she would disappear if she was too loud. She remained silent, but nodded a yes.

Lily couldn't hold it back any longer...She let her emotions take over and leaped the distance between them and latched onto Natalie! Using unbelievable strength she hugged the human tightly and nuzzled her cheek to cheek.
"Oh Nat!" she exclaimed. Lily kept repeating her name over and over again while holding her close. Her eyes began to water up. But she needed more...she planted a small kiss on Natalie's lips. Her hands found themselves ripping apart her dress while she planted small kisses on the base of her neck, working her way up-

A stinging sensation spread across her cheek. It didn't really hurt much, but snapped her back to reality.
"Get off of me you horny lizard!"


The trip out of Natalie was much slower than the way in. It was hard to resist squirming against the tight muscles, but anytime she did it would only slow her exit. When she was finally outside she got away from the other woman. Now that the fear of becoming food was gone, anger was the only thing left. She glared at her supposed fiance, finally getting a good look. She was the taller one, easily over two heads larger than herself. Her messy brown hair was kept at shoulder length, but still held its mousy quality. Her emerald eyes refused to match her heated gaze. The most obvious difference though was her breasts. She was quite busty...her Lily had become quite the woman.

"Nat...is it really you?" she asked. Knowing that she would only be able to speak with a sharp, cruel tongue she simply nodded. Then Lily shot forward and latched onto her! For a moment she was afraid Lily was going to eat her again, but noticed that she simply hugging her with misty eyes.
"Oh Nat!" She seemed so happy...Natalie was about to hug her back when Lily suddenly turned and kissed her! She froze in shock...until she heard the fabric of her dress rip. That was the last straw. She swung and slapped Lily as hard as she could.
"Get off of me you horny lizard!" she shouted. Lily pulled back in shock. She clearly wasn't expected to be rejected like that.
"N-nat? What's wrong?" she asked innocently.
"What's wrong? What's wrong is that you just ate me! Did you think I've already forgotten?!"


Lily flinched. She had actually forgotten about that...
"O-oh, right! I'm sorry about that, it's just-"
"Just that you were expecting a man?"
"Well...yeah, but-"
"Or are you just fine with anyone as long as they're humans? I also remember you grabbing my bosom when I was inside you."
"That-!"
"And now you try to bed me because you assume me some common whore?"
"STOP!" she screamed. Everything Nat was saying was true, and made sense, but...it was wrong! It was right, but wrong! "Just...let me explain myself..."
"Hmph, fine." she huffed.
"Well...I thought you were a man back when we were kids. I know you never said that, but I just assumed. Truth be told, it's actually better because I like women. I was worried about what to do when you showed up..." Looking up, Nat still looked angry but wasn't going to interrupt. "So when you came, I didn't think that it would be you. Then you pulled out the knife I thought you were going to attack our carving...so I ate you."
"And?" she asked, unsatisfied.
"And about touching you like that...I admit that I was wanting to tease you. I tend to do that a lot with my meals...not that I eat a lot of humans! Only the ones that deserve it!"
"And?" she asked again. Lily knew this would be the hard part...
"AND...I missed you so much...and you're so pretty...and I wasn't really thinking about what I was doing. I don't think you're a whore, but I do want to mate with you..."

At that, Nat's cheeks got rosy. "W-well...I guess that explains everything. It shows that you need to think more, but at least it alleviates some of my worries."
"Say...you've been talking like that for a while. And your dressed pretty nice now. And you grew out your hair..." Lily was beating around the bush, but her real question was...


"Yes, I know I've changed. But..." Nat let out a heavy sigh. "I love you. Even after being in your stomach, which I always wished would never happen, I still want to marry you." Lily finally perked up at Natalie's words, a bright smile coming over her face.
"BUT! I want to do it right."
"Whatever it takes..." Lily said dreamily. She slithered back over to Natalie and sat next to her. She leaned over and rested her head against her shoulder.
"Well...first, I should meet your parents. After that, we need a ceremony."
"Is that how humans do it?"
"Yes. I never asked, how do nagas marry?"
"We don't, we mate."
"What's the difference?"
Lily smiled and licked her neck with a surprisingly long tongue. "It means as long as we have sex with love in our hearts, we're together forever." Natalie was about to push back...but instead wrapped her arm around her larger companion.
"Well...that comes later... for now, I'm exhausted. Is it alright if I...stay with you? My old home was destroyed..."
"I wouldn't have it any other way..."
14411.title: Lily latched onto her head (She's human sized)

choices: Pissed off, but easily over it
14412.content:
Natalie could do nothing but scream as the love of her life completely took her entire body inside her mouth. She felt her lips clamp down her ankles before being sucked entirely in. It was impossible to tell before, but apparently Lily was actually a giant naga. When they were children she had yet to reach her growth spurt, so there was no way for her to know.
But there was no time to think about that. Right now, she was busy screaming her head off as the giant tongue of her fiance was probing every nook and cranny of her body. The soft muscle was pushing her all around, and seemed to be focusing on her...sensitive areas... Terror was coursing through her...but she did notice that under different circumstances this could feel good. But those thoughts all flushed away when the maw tilted back and the throat opened...

Lily was in bliss. This human woman...she was just too freaking tasty! It was a shame she had eat her...she was perfect. She was totally her type and delicious on top of it. But the little bitch had turned mean all of a sudden and messed with her carving. It was really hard making the marks that tiny! Her tongue wandered a bit and lapped at the assets she had been admiring. Given the immediate squirming the girl either loved it or hated it. But enough was enough, so she tilted her head back and...

GULP!

"Lily you idiot! It's me!" the girl screamed as she went down the tight throat. Lily perked up up at the mentioning of her name. She looked around but there was no one else around...
"Huh? How do you know my name? Well, it probably doesn't matter anymore little cutie!" she passed off. Without any more thought to the matter she climbed back up and waited for Nat to arrive.

Meanwhile inside her gut, Nat was crying. She couldn't believe Lily. The girl that had promised to love her forever had just swallowed her whole. Even when she had cried out to her...She had just passed it off and ignored her. Now she was going to die in here. Her heart was aching. It felt like she was being ripped apart from the inside out. She felt so betrayed...All she could do was sob as acid began to drop down...

Hours had gone by, yet Lily could still feel the human inside of her. Normally they would have been completely gone by now, yet the little red head still left a pleasant weight inside of her. Oh well, she'll probably be gone by morning... With that in mind she started to head back to her home tree.
While heading on her way she saw a familiar flash of gold.
"So, any progress today?" asked Mana. Lily smiled at her human sized friend before picking her off her branch and placing her on her shoulder.
"No, he didn't show up today. But I did get a nice little surprise..."
"Ooh, I know that face. Did she taste that good, or was she just that pretty?" her friend teased.
"Both, definitely both. I lucked out today, she was totally my type. But she acted pretty weird and tried to attack my old carving."
"Wow, was she a fighter?"
"Not really...actually she's still just laying around in there..."
"Wait, she's still in there?"
"Yeah, I guess she's taking a while to digest..." Mana looked over with annoyed eyes
"Lily, what did this human look like?"
"Oh, she was thin and curvy. Plus she had this long red hair..."
"Like your friend Nat..."
"...these deep blue eyes..."
"Like your friend Nat..."
"...I'm guessing around my age..."
"Like. Your. Friend. Nat." She pointed out, ready to pull her own hair out.
"Why do you keep saying that?"
"Lily listen to this description real quick. A human around your age with red hair, blue eyes, and doesn't digest comes directly to your tree. What does that make you think of?"
"Nat" she replied, a bit confused.
"And do you remember what I was talking about earlier when I said you couldn't tell the gender of Nat because you never the 'downstairs?'"
"Yeah, but what does that have to do wi-" Lily stopped moving as all the cogs began to move in her slow brain. Human+red head+ blue eyes=NAT!
"SHIT!!!" she screamed crouched down to force Nat out of her stomach. Mana quickly coiled around her neck to keep from falling off. Lily began to regurgitate as fast as could, forcing Nat's unconscious body into her waiting hands. A wave of relief came over her to see that she was still breathing...and then a deep blush as she saw her clothes and been melted off.
"WOW! You said she was pretty but...WOW!" Mana said, staring. "Hey, if she's down with it do you wanna go for a three-way?" Lily glared over as she placed a hand to cover the unconscious girl. She took off as fast as she could towards her tree to lay the girl down.
Once arriving she quickly weaved together a makeshift bed out of leaves and covered Nat from the aroused eyes of Mana. Emotions long buried were flooding through her all at once as she gazed down at sleeping human. She had always been a woman. Her beloved Nat really was perfect for her. She had loved Nat as a person, but had tried to push away her emotions because she wasn't attracted to men. But Nat was a woman...and just her type too. She gently brushed some of the scarlet hair out of her face. This could still work out for them...
A cold shiver ran down her back as she realized that Nat may want to call it off. Sure she had returned just like she promised, but Lily had just ruined it. Instead of a heartwarming reunion she had swallowed down her fiance and ignored her cries. She had a deep pit in her stomach. The guilt and fear was only getting worse as she heard Nat rustling.

How does Natalie react when she wakes up?
14412.title: Lily you idiot!

144121.content:
Lily felt was wringing her hands together nervously as she watched Nat stirring in her sleep. Her lovely blue eyes slowly opened, glancing in all directions. A tree...a bed of leaves...no clothes...a giant naga watching over her...

"Um...hi Nat..." Lily said, her voice nearly cracking with nervousness.
"So...you finally recognized me, huh?" Natalie said with a slight smile. "Lily...come closer" she said with a weak voice. The giant naga felt her heart pounding painfully hard in her chest, but she slithered a bit closer.

"Closer...I need to tell you something..." the human said, weakly reaching out a hand towards her childhood friend. Lily felt her guilt rising as Nat spoke so weakly. She must be traumatized from being swallowed alive like that. The giant naga moved slowly, trying not to startle her as she lowered her head down close to Nat.

"Lily...YOU FUCKING MORON!" Natalie screamed, suddenly sitting up and punching Lily on the nose. The red head stood up and started to pound her little fists against Lily's surprised face, not hurting her at all. "What the hell kind of reaction is that?! I sneak away from those noble bastards, manage to come all the way back these woods, avoid all the other nagas, just for you to EAT me when I show up?!" she berated in an angry fit.

The giant naga took her blows, barely even feeling the impact. She really did deserve this much punishment...
"And why the hell did you think I was a boy?! Do you realize how worried I've been that you wouldn't want to be with me anymore?!" she yelled, her voice beginning to crack. Looking down at her, Lily saw that the little human was starting to cry as her punches weakened. "Does...does this mean...you really don't want to be with me anymore?" she asked weakly.

Lily finally responded, scooping Nat into her hands and giving her a small kiss on the head.
"Nat...I'm truly sorry that I swallowed you. I...I would never hurt you. It's been so long...I'm sorry I didn't recognize you right away. I'm not really the smartest girl in the woods. But...I love you. I really do" she said, feeling her nerves fade away. This was her ideal situation...the human she fell in love with was a woman, just her type...and still wanted to be with her!

Natalie let out a tense breath, relieved to hear that it truly had been an accident.
"Well...I love you too...you big dummy..." she muttered, standing up in her palms to give her on her lower lip.

The couple, reunited, then decide to...
144121.title: The Understanding Type

choices: Lily successfully argues back how she ensured Nat's survival. Nat had forgotten.
Nat asks whether someone as merciless as Lily has proven to be CAN love at all.
144122.content:
Natalie woke up cold. In a way, this helped, as this realization forced her to focus and take in her surroundings as quickly as possible. A bed of leaves, in a giant tree, inhabited by a treacherous giant naga. Natalie sized her up in the two ways she learned how - as one did a physical rival one was likely to scuffle with as she did when she was a child, as a rival lady at court who was engaged in schemes to benefit herself and might arrange for anyone else's downfall if it would help.

Neither perspective looked good. Lily had grown to humongous proportions, and had the biggest home-field advantage Nat could imagine. Lily had also proven that she attached no value to human life and did not care enough to remember anything at all about those she struck deals with.

"...Hi, Nat," Lily said, her voice wavering as she saw the human's eyes had become filled with fear and betrayal. "You grew up beautifully."

"So you do know me," Natalie responded neutrally, before responding on the same topic, "You've grown in directions I scarcely imagined."

"Is that how humans talk to each other?" Lily asked.

"The ones I had to deal with," Nat responded, "I did hope to get away from all that, but it seems to be the only thing you let me keep."

"Oh,"

"Lilly, why did you undress me while I was unconscious?" Natilie maneuvered.

"Well, It's not that I undressed you... you just... lost your clothes inside me?" Lily weakly explained.

"For a moment, I dared hope that was a nightmare," Natilie said, covering her fear with anger, "So, what happens now?"

"Nat, I'm sorry!" the giant naga said, "I didn't recognize you!"

"I find that hard to believe," Nat responded, "But I'll let you elaborate. Why not?"

"I, well, I thought you were a boy, back then," Lily continued.

"You did imply such," Natalie admitted, "But I've never hid my gender from anyone, for as long as I've lived. And the girl I fell in love with was no fool."

Lily winced. Now that Nat mentioned it, she didn't remember her human friend ever calling themself a boy. When they were first getting to know each other, it hadn't mattered. She'd only applied the "boy" label later. "W-well, you never said you were a girl either."

"...That may be true. I always did focus more on my friend's actions when I thought back to those times," Nat admitted, starting to cry.

"Nat, I'm sorry. It was an accident," Lily tried to explain herself.

"No," Nat cut her off, "The one thing I learned among my own kind that's actually useful: Accidents don't exist among adults. When someone says they did something accidentally, they're really saying that there isn't evidence of the conspiracy." She met the giant naga's eyes again, "You planned on eating me the moment you saw me. When I began to realize that your side of our love had become a lie, you struck and savored my despair..."

"Nat, no!" Lily shouted, leaning back, "It wasn't like that! I never planned on eating you!" Except, that wasn't the truth was it? She had planned to eat that traveler, but she hadn't realized it was Nat. ...Except why didn't she? It wasn't like there was anyone else who'd visit their carving so purposefully... Hadn't she enjoyed dismissing Nat so?

"My beloved was not the kind of person who kills on a whim, Lily," Nat's logic seemed undeniable at the moment. "You... She makes plans, and never lets anything get in the way of what she sets out to do..." She slumped over, hugging herself. Her own argument was breaking her mind apart, "We spent a decade together, so why wouldn't I have seen this coming...?"

"True love conquers everything. Conversely... I... You..." she breaks down crying.

Lily couldn't bear to look. Oh why wasn't this a Nightmare?
144122.title: Admitting the Worst

1441222.content:
Natalie's thoughts were scattered as she cried into her hands. Ever since being reunited with her human family, she had been trained to withhold her emotions. Being swayed by something as fickle as emotions could be life or death in a court of nobles. Even with all the pain she held inside over the years, she never cried. Yet before the woman she loved, she was sobbing like a child.

Her angry facade had crumbled apart in the strong current of her sorrow. The tears and the pain just wouldn't stop. Everything that had built up inside herself was flowing out all at once. She had dealt with physical and verbal abuse constantly. That was simple. But after being eaten by Lily... She felt so hurt and betrayed she just wanted to disappear. Maybe she should have just been digested...

"Nat...P-please don't cry..." Lily weakly asked. "I honestly didn't know it was you...I would never try to eat you..." She slowly reached a hand out towards Nat. She longed to make contact, to stroke her and hold her close. To tell her that everything was going to be alright. However, when Nat saw the giant hand approaching she recoiled in fear. "I...I still love you..."

"N-no!" she cried out. Lily's hand snapped back, not wanting to make things even worse. But it was too late. "You love me? Is someone as merciless as you even capable of love?" Nat curled back up and cried further at this. Did she really mean that? Not even she could tell at this point...

Lily gasped in shock. It hurt for her to hear such a cruel thing from someone she loved. She felt awful. Was this how she made Nat feel? She even felt a little bit angry at her for saying such a thing. But it wasn't her fault, really. Nat was just lashing out her pain. Maybe she really did ruin their chances at love...

NO!

This is not the way their engagement ended! Sure she made some mistakes, but there was no way Lily would just sit back and lose Nat again over something so stupid as a misunderstanding!

"Damnit Nat!" she yelled. Her fist slammed into the bark of the tree, breaking a hole clean through to the other side. The tiny redhead shot up to attention and stared wide eyed, pausing her crying to outright quiver in fear. Lily wanted to apologize, but knew she needed to say this first. "Look, I know I messed up. I've been an idiot for not even considering the possibility that you were a woman. I was so convinced that you were a boy back then that I couldn't be swayed." Without warning, the naga wrapped more of her tail around Rosetta, covering her mouth, before silently slithering away, dragging the helpless girl along. For almost an hour the naga slithered through the forest, eventually coming to the base of a mountain. Without the slightest hint of exertion, the naga pushed aside a fairly large boulder revealing a cave. The naga slithered in, bringing Rosetta in too, before pulling the boulder back into place.


“You’ll be taking my mate’sss place in helping me raise my young onesss.” The naga said as she continued slithering, eventually stopping in a cavern lighted by glowing crystals.

Despite being scared silly, Rosetta was amazed at the beauty of the cave. There were three tunnels leading from the room, the one ahead of them was dark and seemingly forbidden. To their left Rosetta could hear three young voices, two of which she was sure were female. But it was the one to their right that the naga started towards.

“You’ll be sssleeping in my eldessst daughter’sss room. Ssshe’sss old enough to not be corrupted by you ssshould you try to convince her to let you essscape.” The naga said before opening a stone door then shoving Rosetta in.

Rosetta stood up shakily as the naga closed the door and looked around. The only thing of real notice was the naga girl, who looked to be about Rosetta’s age laying on a slightly raised stone bed looking at her.

“Hello there.” The naga said warmly, rising from her bed and slithering over to Rosetta. “So you’re the human mother chose to take revenge on for my father’s death huh?”

“It- it wasn’t my doing. I swear! I was just bait, I was helpless. I- hold on, you didn’t slur your S’s.” Rosetta said quickly.

“Nah, I don’t. It annoys the Hell outta Mum, but there’s not much she can do about it.” The naga smiled. “Well, since we’ll be sleeping in the same room, we might as well know each other’s names at least. My actual name is probably too complicated for someone who can’t speak the language of the nagas, so just call me Zarla.”

“I’m, Rosetta.” Rosetta replied nervously.

“Aw, you don’t need to be so scared of me.” Zarla said comfortingly, “I’ll admit your fear is probably well placed; after all I have eaten several humans over the course of my life; but you don’t need to worry about me eating you. Mum would gut me alive if I did.”

Rosetta was too stunned to say anything, though she probably wouldn’t know what to say anyway.

Hours later, Rosetta heard a loud voice making various loud hisses coming from the other side of the stone door to Zarla’s room. She realized it was the naga language when Zarla responded with similar hisses. “Well, it’s time to get to sleep.” Zarla said before slithering back to her stone bed.

“Um, where should I sleep?” Rosetta asked.

“Well, there’s really only one place to.” Zarla replied patting the smooth stone next to her.

Rosetta gulped nervously, but eventually her exhaustion forced her to lie down next to Zarla, after a few moments she drifted to sleep.


It was the middle of the night when Zarla heard the shivers of the human girl next to her. Making sure not to wake Rosetta, Zarla gently wrapped her snake tail around Rosetta and pulled her closer to share her warmth.


Rosetta awoke the next morning, quickly noticing Zarla’s tail around her and that her face was gently being hugged to the naga’s breasts.

1523.content:
Mira checked her repeater-rifle again before turning the corner. She and four others had been sent to a place the general referred to as “The Facility”. Hidden in a dense forest and known only to the highest links in the chain of command, the Facility supposedly was working on new weapons for the ever increasingly bloody war. However, something went wrong and no reports had come from the Facility in weeks. Only in desperation was Mira’s team sent to investigate.

The Facility stretched downward nearly two thousand feet into the soil, completely hiding it underground. The entrance rooms were only eight foot squares with six feet diameter tubes descending to the main parts of the Facility. The Facility itself was enormous; the rooms were cubes two hundred feet on each side with tunnels at least 100 feet wide leading to similar rooms. These huge rooms and tunnels were likely for missiles and other weapons the Facility was developing; there was another network of rooms and tunnels of smaller size including labs, barracks, mess halls, and recreation rooms.

Mira felt uneasy, no matter where she looked there was nothing. No dead bodies, no signs of life, nothing but her and the dim lighting of the tunnels.


“This is unit 019, report.” A voice ordered from Mira’s communicator.

“205 reporting. I’m in the power control room, nothing out of the ordinary.” Another voice crackled, Mira adjusted the frequency on her comm to pick up her squad mate’s signal better. 205 was the deepest down in the Facility, at least as deep as he could go since the lowest level was strangely sealed off.

“098 here, the barracks are clean. But it’s odd, nothing’s been moved, it’s like nothing’s happened.” A third voice chimed in.

“This is 186, I don’t see anything wrong where I’m at.” The fourth and only other female of the group reported.

Mira tapped the talk button on her comm, “157 reporting in, I’ve got nothing.”

“Acknowledged squad. We’ve covered everywhere we can, let’s head out and report to the general. Maybe he can get us access to the lower levels.” 019 said.

“Right away sir, I’ll- wait! What was- HOLY SH-” Mira heard 205 shout before static burst out the comm’s speaker.

“205 come in. 205 do you read?” 019 shouted.

“It’s no good sir, we’ve lost all contact.” 098 said.

“Damn, alright 186, 157, rendezvous at Lab 17 then start looking for 205. 098 stay where you are and I’ll meet you there, then we’ll do the same.”

Mira acknowledged before heading off, keeping close to the walls for cover.

Mira was at Lab 17 just before her partner got there. “What do you think happened to Doug?” Mira asked, dropping the military tone for her friend as they started their part of the search.

“I don’t know, but here’s hoping he just knocked himself out.” Terra replied.


The two ladies had been searching for about ten minutes when they came across something. “Terra, look at this.” Mira said pointing towards her discovery.

“That tunnel, it’s open. And if I remember the layout, it leads down to the lowest level. But I thought it was closed before.” Terra replied.

“Well, it’s open now. And Doug may have opened it.” Mira said before flicking on her comm, “Sir, this is 157, 186 and I just found a tunnel leading to the bottom. We’re going in to investigate, 205 may be down there.”

“Acknowledged, be careful.” 019 replied.


“Wow, look at all this junk.” Terra commented as she and Mira exited the tunnel.

“I guess this is where all the stuff they were working on up above was stored. Everything’s against the walls though, why is that?” Mira wondered aloud.

Terra turned on her comm to report their location and findings, but she only got static. “Great, something down here’s blocking the signal.”

Mira grimaced, “Well, let’s head down that big tunnel and see what we can find.”


Several minutes later Mira and Terra did indeed find something. Or rather something found them. Mira spotted the danger first. “Terra, get down!” She shouted. But it was too late. Without pause a huge snake tail wrapped around them pinning their arms to their sides and forcing their guns away. Mira followed the tail, which seemed to go on for at least a hundred feet, with her eyes to its owner. Where the tail stopped started a gigantic woman’s waist. From there it went on to a giantess's chest and head.

“A naga giantess.” Terra whispered nervously, “I thought the Animal-Hybrid and Giant Size projects were being done separately.”

“Apparently not.” Mira whispered back, remembering the briefing they received earlier.

“Splendid, finally some females,” the naga said happily.

“Oh God, she’s going to eat us.” Terra moaned.

“Oh God, we’re doomed. If they nuke this place…” Terra moaned as she sat down.

“Don’t be like that. I doubt out captor is going to let herself be nuked.” Mira replied kneeling beside her friend.


Selina smiled to herself as the soldiers left. “I was beginning to wonder when they’d finally get rid of me.” She said softly. Even after her transformation she remembered everything. She was in jail when it started; taking the blame for a crime her husband committed and pinned on her. It worked out quite well for her husband, since she was from the nation her captors were at war with she was thrown in jail without trial. Barely a week later the soldiers came again and dragged her to the Facility, where she’d been prodded, probed, and injected for months. Then there was the day they transformed her, the current of energy flowing through her was indescribable, as was the pain of the ordeal. But she was able to get some revenge; she snuck out of her cell into one of the labs in the Facility and managed to get her hands on the growth formula. With her transformation and new stature she killed the scientists that tortured her.

With her vengeful lust quenched, her attentions were pulled to herself. She come to enjoy her new form and wanted to continue and grow her new species. With some skill and luck she discovered how she could do so without the aid of a male, she’s come to hate them since her husband got her in jail and all the scientists were men.


Selina brought her mind back to the present, and to the two women who would soon be the next generation of giant nagas. “Don’t worry about those nasty ‘people’ my dears. I won’t let them harm you.” She said warmly as she caressed her belly.


Mira heard what Selina said. She wanted to shout back several profane words, but somehow she felt comforted by the tone. Then she felt the movement. “Terra, she’s moving.”

“She’s not the only one.” Terra said shakily pointing at a pair of umbilical cords that were growing towards them.
Mira suppressed a shudder and spoke calmly to Terra, “Well, like I said ealier, I don’t think there’s anything we can do about it. But look at it this way, everyone always said we acted like sisters, now we’re actually going to be sisters.”

Terra looked into her friend’s eyes as the cords came closer, “Well, at least this is happening to me with a good friend like you to support me.” At that moment the cord attached to them, in an instant the two girls lost consciousness and their transformation began.


Nine months later Selina was in a new forest far from the lab and gave birth to her twins, who she named Rachel and Felicia.

152322221212.content:
The next four years were fairly uneventful for the family of nagas. A team came to search for the missing people from the helicopter platform the day after Rachel and Felicia’s first hunt for humans. And a year after that new city was started forcing the nagas deeper into the forest, but on the plus side humans were now more plentiful.

On the day of the twins 18th birthday their mother called them back to the cave early that evening.

“Well girls, this was a big day. You’re both now fully fledged adults. Ready to head out into the world and live life to it’s fullest.” Selina said. She was both joyful and sad, the girls had planned to, as she had just said, head out into the world on their own; promising to visit her every so often of course. “Now, someday I hope to have grandchildren, so you two need to know how we have children.”

Felicia was excited, she been waiting for this day like she had her first hunt for humans. “How do we do it Mom?” She asked, “Do we do it like humans do it? If we do it’ll be tough, I’ve never seen any other naga except you and Rachel.”

“That’s because we are the only nagas there are Felicia. In fact, I myself wasn’t a naga for very long before I had the two of you.” Selina explained, “Believe it or not dears I used to be a human, but I was wronged and tested upon like some filthy animal. They transformed me, planned to use me for their concept of justice. But I escaped and I grew. It was not long after that I gave birth to you two. As fortune would have it I was pregnant when they transformed me, they changed you two without even knowing it.” Selina knew she was lying about that last part, but she didn’t want her daughters to know the truth. She loved them dearly and was afraid how they’d feel towards her if they knew how they were really conceived.

“We were almost humans?” Rachel asked in disbelief.

“So what? Like humans say, ‘almost only counts in Horseshoes and with hand grenades’. But enough history, what about the future. How do we have kids?” Felicia asked with mild annoyance.

Selina chuckled before she started explaining. “It was difficult for me to figure out how you could continue our species, but a few years ago I found a way. First you’ll need to find a suitable human, and you know how I feel about men so you’d better find a woman for this. Then you remove all their clothing and anything on their person. And then finally you bring them down here,” she paused and pointed to her sex, “and push them in.”

“Oh, I get it. We get them into our womb which then turns them into a naga like us.” Felicia said excitedly. Rachel found this exciting as well, but she kept it hidden better than her sister.

“That’s right Felicia. Now I suggest you don’t do it right after you move out. You should be well settled by proper resources before you think about having children. And I also strongly recommend you have only one at first, after she’s eight or so you can think about another. I love you two very much, but you were such pains when you were little.” Selina said, “Well, it’s time we got to sleep girls. I guess I should say ladies now.”


The night didn’t go by swiftly for Selina, but morning came all the same.

“Goodbye Rachel. Goodbye Felicia.” Selina said hugging them in turn, “I know you’ll both do great things out there.”

“Bye Mom” Rachel relpied.

“We’ll visit you soon.” Felicia promised. With the goodbyes said the two nagas slithered together from their old home.


They went the same way for almost an hour before they went their separate ways.

“So long Sis. I’ll miss you.” Rachel said as she hugged Felicia.

“I’ll miss you too, Sis. See you around.” Felicia replied as she returned the embrace. And then the two left each other, heading on their own paths to new parts of the forest.

info.description:
Nagas in this story are similar to these: http://fc09.deviantart.net/fs41/f/2009/039/d/c/Outlaw_naga_by_Karbo.jpg

Please follow these rules (I reserve the right to edit and/or delete chapters) :
The nagas are about a big as a normal humans, unless otherwise noted in the story
No one-liners
Not too descriptive sex allowed
No scat; if it goes into the sewer DO NOT write about it
